qas.question: What type of anthropology tries to understand the social aspects of mass media?
Media production and media reception are examples of what type of context?
What type of anthropology involves the relatively new area of internet search?
Media such as a radio and television have started to make their presences felt since what years?
Following audiences in their everyday responses to media is encompassed by what type of context?
What is the study of Mass Media?
What type of anthropology involves the internet and roboticas?
What form of media began to lose its presence in the 1990's?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Media anthropology<b5_0/><a0_0/> (also known as anthropology of media or mass media) emphasizes ethnographic studies as a means of understanding producers, audiences, and other cultural and social aspects of mass media. The types of <a1_0>ethnographic<a1_0/> contexts explored range from contexts of media production (e.g., ethnographies of newsrooms in newspapers, journalists in the field, film production) to contexts of <a4_0>media reception<a4_0/>, following audiences in their everyday responses to media. Other types include <a2_0><b6_0>cyber<a2_0/> anthropology<b6_0/>, a relatively new area of internet research, as well as ethnographies of other areas of research which happen to involve media, such as development work, social movements, or health education. This is in addition to many classic ethnographic contexts, where media such as <b7_0>radio<b7_0/>, the press, new media and television have started to make their presences felt since the <a3_0>early 1990s<a3_0/>.
